snippet: The bombings in Quetta and the Swat Valley offered harrowing evidence of how Pakistan’s myriad internal conflicts may destabilize the country as elections approach.
abstract: Bomb blasts in Quetta and Swat Valley, Pakistan, kill at least 115 people and wound more than 270, offering harrowing evidence of how country’s myriad internal conflicts could destabilize it as elections approach.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The bombings in Quetta and the Swat Valley offered harrowing evidence of how Pakistan’s myriad internal conflicts may destabilize the country as elections approach.

headline.seo: Blasts in Pakistan Kill Scores and Raise Fears Over Elections
headline.main: Blasts in Pakistan Kill Scores and Stir Fears on Elections
headline.print_headline: Blasts in Pakistan Kill Scores and Stir Fears on Elections
